Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and draw two different habitats, one on land and one in water.

The student can draw various types of living things in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, and animals like lizards, squirrels, and ants in land habitats and fish and clams in water habitats.
The student can compare and label the different types of living things found in each habitat.
The student can use their drawings to show how there are patterns in plant and animal diversity across different habitats.
